section.title: Creation of new Group Profiles
section.para: The user with administrative privileges can manage the creation of various groups corresponding to the various contributors/users of the database (e.g. in the FAO-GeoNetwork node you may find as many groups as GIS Projects that produce general geographic information in different fields of activities: Fishery, Agriculture, Land and Water, Health etc).

To create new groups you should first of all authenticate yourself and determine if you have the required administrative privileges. To log in, simply go to the homepage and enter your username and password in the top right corner fields (use admin for both username and password), then click on the login button ().

listitem.para: From the Administration page displayed, select the option related to group management ().
To include a new group in the system, you have to apply the following logical steps:
From the Group Management page click on the button Add a new group;
Provide the information related to the new group that you are going to create;
Click on Save

section.para: Depending on the data owner settings, for each record inserted in the system, each group will have different data accessibility privileges in relation to: view of Metadata ( Publish ), data Download, Interactive Map visualization, view of your map appearing on the home page randomly (Featured), Notification when a file gets downloaded.

section.title: User Profiles
section.para: Each group has a number of users with different profiles (administrator, user administrator, content reviewer, editor, registered user) varying in number with respect to the group composition/organization (e.g., one administrator, two user administrators, two content reviewers, five editors and one registered user profile).
User profiles are illustrated in details in the list below:

listitem.para: Administrator Profile
The Administrator has special privileges that allow for several management activities:
Full rights for creating new groups and new users
Rights to change users/groupsâ€™ profiles
Full rights for creating/editing/deleting new/old metadata
User Administrator Profile
The User Administrator is the administrator of his/her own group with the following privileges:
Full rights on creating new users within the own group
Rights to change users profiles within the own group
Full rights on creating/editing/ deleting new/old data within the own group
Content Reviewer Profile
The content reviewer is the only person allowed to give final clearance on the metadata publication on the Intranet and/or on the Internet:
Rights on reviewing metadata content within the own group and authorizing its publication
Editor Profile
The User Administrator is the administrator of his/her own group with the following privileges:
Full rights on creating/editing/ deleting new/old data within the own group
Registered User Profile
The User Administrator is the administrator of his/her own group with the following privileges:
Right to download protected data

section.title: Creation of new User Profiles
section.para: To include a new user in the GeoNetwork system you will have to apply the following logical steps:

listitem.para: Select User Management from the Administration link in the toolbar ();
Click the button Add a new user to the Database ();
Provide the information required for the new user ();
Assign the correct profile;
Assign the user to a group;
Click on Save.
